history.text: hello
Hello, do you like fantasy animation movies? Because How to train your dragon is pretty famous for its dramedy. Good for children and adults.
yes, I do like fantasy animation.
did you watch this movie?
Was directed by the same who directed Lilo & Stich,  this movie is about a aerial battles between tamed dragons.
wow! that must be fun. tamed dragons? how did it work?
Yes, besides the plot of the movie which is funny as you said, there are also evil ones. It has good featuring.
dragons were all by themselves? or, people were riding on them?
my wild imagination - lol
hahaha, there is people also. People is who train them.
the plot is in the future - I guess
Actually, not. Like in the medieval environment like fantasy movies
that's interesting. do you know how long is the movie?
YesI don't know.
Yes, it is interesting, thrilling action-adventure 3-D animation.
I guess - it'd be usual two hour movie
usally
usually

yes, something like that. 
It is close to Pixar's movies.
great! I like the 3d movies these days. they look so real. what do you think?
Oh I remember, is in a viking village, and the dragons steal livestock. That's why people have to train them.
I can imagine - dragons snatching livestock away.
Hiccup is the name of the principal character and his dragon Toothles, cute and funny.
what a name - they do have imaginations. do you know how it ended?
This movie is from 2010.
ok, I'd still love to see it. it sounds very interesting.
probably, they are available on dvd. what do you think?
Well, after Hiccup subdues a captive drragon on his final training test instead of killing it, everyone becames anger but Toothless attempts tp  protect Hiccup.
And I cannot tell you more because you have to see it.
sure I will. you got me hooked in this movie.
do you know who directed it?
Yes, I hope you will. The directors are Chris Sanders and Dean DeBlois.
cool. and who are the actors and actresses?
ok, I will wait for the movie to find it out. nice talking to you.
bye.
Well, the voice cast is Jay Baruchel as Hiccup, the bad guy on the movie who got anger is Stoick the Vast, who Gerard Butler do his voice
bye, enjoy it.
thank you.

uid1response.feedback: The other user made me interested in the movie. That was a pleasant conversation. Enjoyed it.
